ferritin.description: Ferritin levels indirectly measures the total amount of iron stored in your body. It acts as a buffer against iron deficiency and iron overload.
ferritin.low: Your levels show a risk for lack of iron, which could lead to anemia, a decrease in the amount of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood, reducing the ability of blood to carry oxygen. It can lead to shortness of breath, tired feeling, and weakness.
ferritin.normal: Your levels show that you have a sufficient amount of iron in your blood to assist in carrying oxygen throughout your body.
ferritin.high: Your levels show excess iron levels, or is a sign of infection. High ferritin levels can signal iron overload disorders, such as hemochromatosis which is an inherited disease.

iron.description: Iron is a mineral that your body needs for many functions. It helps your muscle store and use oxygen and it is also a component of hemoglobin, a protein that distributes oxygen from your lungs throughout your body.
iron.low: Your levels show low iron levels, and could lead to iron deficiency, also known as anemia. Low levels could be due to blood loss or a lack of ability to absorb iron from your diet.
iron.normal: Your levels show that you have a sufficient amount of iron in your blood to assist in carrying oxygen throughout your body.
iron.high: Your levels show an overload of iron in your body. This could be due to taking too many iron supplements which could lead to iron poisoning, or hemochromatosis which is an inherited disease.

glucose.description: Glucose is a type of sugar that your body uses for energy, and is the main source of fuel for your brain.
glucose.low: Without enough glucose, your body cannot perform its normal functions. Low blood glucose is also known as hypoglycemia. This could be a side effect of diabetes treatment and could lead to pale skin, blurry vision, and dizziness, to name a few.
glucose.normal: Your levels show that the level of glucose in your blood is constant. Your pancreas is working normally to make insulin, which brings the glucose in your blood steam into your cells.
glucose.high: This is also known as hyperglycemia. High blood glucose could damage the vessels that carry blood into your organs. It can also increase your risk for heart disease, kidney disease, and nerve damage.

rbc.description: Red blood cells contain hemoglobin, which is in charge of carrying oxygen to your body’s tissues. The number of red blood cells you have affect how much oxygen your tissues receive, and your tissues need oxygen to function
rbc.low: Your value can be due to anemia or certain drugs. Any recent dietary changes could also change your red blood cell count. A low red blood cell count could indicate that your tissues are not receiving enough oxygen.
rbc.normal: Your value shows that you have a normal amount of red blood cells and that your tissues are receiving an adequate amount of oxygen they need to function.
rbc.high: Your value indicates you have erythrocytosis and may be due to a decrease in oxygen supply. This condition can make your blood thicker and lead to blood clots or other complications.

hemoglobin.description: Hemoglobin is a protein in red blood cells that carries and facilities the process of moving oxygen from the lungs to the rest of the body. It also aids the process of metabolism throughout the body. Hemoglobin helps maintain the shape of red blood cells as well.
hemoglobin.low: Your value can be due to anemia. There are many forms of anemia and each have different causes and symptoms.
hemoglobin.normal: Your value shows that you have a normal amount hemoblogin. The amount of hemoglobin in the blood affects the movement of oxygen throughout the body and maintains healthy red blood cells.
hemoglobin.high: Your value shows that you have an above-normal level of hemoglobin in your blood. High levels of hemoglobin are associated with smoking and living in high altitudes.

hematocrit.description: Hematocrit is the ratio of red blood cells to total volume of blood in a person. Red blood cells are used to carry oxygen throughout the body.
hematocrit.low: Less than 42%. Low levels of hematocrit are often referred to anemia. This is associated with hemophilia, ulcers, sickle cell disease, and internal bleeding.
hematocrit.normal: Normal levels of hematocrit is between 42% and 54%. These levels of hematocrit are associated with proper respiration, good heart function, and balanced energy levels.
hematocrit.high: High levels of hematocrit are above 54%. Such high levels are associated with dehydration, kidney disease, and heart disease.

wbc.description: White blood cells are infection-fighting cells in the blood.
wbc.low: A low concentration of white blood cells in your body is less than 1,500 microliter. This condition is called Neutropenia and your body’s natural ability to fight off infection is decreased.
wbc.normal: 4,300-10,800 cells per cubic millimeter of blood. Your body has a good amount of white blood cells to fight off foreign agents in your body.
wbc.high: More than 11,000 cells per cubic millimeter of blood is a high concentration level of white blood cells in your body. This condition is called Leukocytosis and their is an inflammatory response (reddened, swollen, hot, and painful reaction) in your body.

platelet.description: Platelets are blood cells that help clot blood to stop bleeding.
platelet.low: Less than 150,000 per microliter of blood. With a low amount of platelets in your system, getting a cut is dangerous as your blood will not clot very fast. Bleeding from small wounds can be serious.
platelet.normal: 150,000-450,000 per microliter of blood. With this level of platelets in your system, your body can clot blood regularly.
platelet.high: More than 450,000 per microliter of blood. With a high concentration of platelets this can lead a person to have reactions to medicine and it can cause inflammation within the body.

thyroid_stimulating_hormone.description: The thyroid stimulating hormone is produced in your brain and signals your thyroid to release thyroid hormones into your blood that regulates the way your body uses energy. It plays a crucial role in regulating body temperature, muscle strength, and mood.
thyroid_stimulating_hormone.low: Your levels indicate hyperthyroidism and that your thyroid is making too much of the thyroid hormone. This can be caused by Graves disease or too much iodine in your system, to name a few.
thyroid_stimulating_hormone.normal: Your levels show that your thyroid is making enough thyroid hormones and that your thyroid is working correctly.
thyroid_stimulating_hormone.high: Your levels indicate hypothyroidism and that your thyroid is not making enough of the thyroid hormone. This can be caused by pregnancy, steroids, dopamine, or opioid painkillers.

lipid_panel.description: Cholesterol is a necessary substance produced by the body to make hormones, vitamin D, and digest food. It consists of high-density lipoprotein (HDL), low-density lipoprotein (LDL), and triglycerides. HDL is considered good cholesterol because it transports cholesterol to the liver to be filtered out. LDL and triglycerides are bad cholesterol because they lead to plaque buildup in the arteries.
lipid_panel.low: Your levels indicate low levels of cholesterol. This is generally considered better than high cholesterol, but health issues may result if levels go below 40mg/dl. This may lead to an increased risk for cancer, hemorrhagic stroke, depression, and anxiety
lipid_panel.normal: Your levels indicate your body is producing the right amount of cholesterol and your liver is functioning properly in removing excess cholesterol.
lipid_panel.high: Your values indicate high cholesterol. This increases your risk of blocked arteries and developing heart disease.

creatinine.description: Creatinine is a waste product that comes from normal wear and tear of the muscles. Creatinine is a good estimate of kidney health since your kidneys filter creatinine out of your bloodstream
creatinine.low: Your levels show a possibility of impaired kidney function or excess water loss. Creatinine production is linked to muscle mass, low values may also be linked to muscular diseases, such as muscular dystrophy. Drugs, pregnancy, and muscular diseases may be causes.
creatinine.normal: Your levels show healthy kidney function.
creatinine.high: Your levels show possible impaired kidney function or kidney disease. Kidneys filter creatinine from the blood. Some causes may be high blood pressure, diabetes, and drugs.

fasting_glucose.description: Fasting glucose is your blood sugar levels as depicted in between meals. It offers information on how well your body manages sugar.
fasting_glucose.low: Your level is also known as hypoglycemia. It is common in people with Type 1 diabetes and symptoms may show as shaking, sweating, dizzy, disoriented, feeling week, trouble concentrating, and in extreme cases, unconsciousness and seizures. Eating or drinking carbohydrates, or taking glucose pills can bring this value up to the normal range. Causes of low fasting glucose could be hypopituitarism, underactive thyroid, tumor in the pancreas, liver disease, or kidney disease
fasting_glucose.normal: Your levels show you are taking eating well in providing glucose for your cells to use as energy. Fasting glucose is also used to screen for diabetes, and a normal range is a good indicator that you do not have diabetes.
fasting_glucose.high: Your levels can mean you either have impaired fasting glucose, or you have diabetes. Other causes could include hyperactive thyroid, pancreatic problems (cancer, inflammation, etc), or stress from cardiovascular problems.

biotin.description: Biotin is a vitamin found in small amounts in eggs, milk, or bananas. In your body, it assists in breaking down carbohydrates and fat
biotin.low: Your level is rare and often come with symptoms of hair thinning, hair loss, brittle nails, skin infection and rashes, and seizures. Taking biotin pills can help elevate levels to normal.
biotin.normal: Your level of biotin shows your dietary intake of foods is good and providing the necessary amount of B vitamin for your body’s metabolism.
biotin.high: Your level does not currently have significant health risks, but may falsely influence lab results which could lead to improper treatment of other health problems
